intro: Hieracium charitopoides, commonly known as the charitopoides hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that bears yellow ray florets surrounded by tubular disk florets. The plant is native to Europe and has been introduced to other parts of the world, often growing in disturbed soils and open habitats. It typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters and has a fibrous root system. The species is noted for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in meadows and along roadsides.
